text:
- Welcome to our tiny
fridge in our tiny home.
(laughs)
(electronic music)
Hello adventurers!

If you are new to this
channel, my name is Kristen.

I got my lovely husband
behind the camera, Siya!
(laughs)
And this is Hopscotch the Globe.

This channel is all about
living your best life
through travel and alternative living.

We live in 1976 Airstream and
when we're not living in this,
we're traveling internationally,
and we inspire people and teach people

how to live this type
of lifestyle, as well.

Now we've done quite a few
Airstream videos in the past,
but this month is all about Airstream.
We're calling it Airstream-a-thon

and so for the next four
weeks you can expect
every single video that is released
to be all Airstream related.

This video has been highly
requested by so many of you guys,
so here it is, what's in our fridge?
I absolutely love food and love cooking
and love grocery shopping,
its like going to Disney World for me.
So, I just went grocery shopping yesterday
to pick a up few things.

It's not always the same
stuff over and over again.
This is what we're eating right now,

but there are things
that we continue to eat
and continue to buy at the grocery store
every single time we go because it's just,
we just love certain things.
We need to have them in our fridge.

It is a small fridge,
but it does pack a lot.
Its impressive.
We probably grocery shop once a week,
and maybe pick up extra produce
another time during the week.
On the door here we have sparkling water
that we've been obsessed with.

It's called bubly, and it
has really, super low sodium,
and a hint of flavor.
This one is grapefruit, not my favorite.

I really love the orange
and the strawberry.

This is all that they had at
the grocery store this time.
We have some jam and almond butter.
We always have some sort of nut butter.

Peanut butter and then
maybe a cashew butter,

or an almond butter is
very common for us to have.
(electronic music)

On the top shelf here we
have grass-fed butter.
We like to put this in coffee sometimes,

to make a bullet coffee,
or we cook with it.
We've got a bunch of different cheese

because I've been obsessed with
cheese, pregnant especially.
We just really like cheese.
So we got all different kinds.

One of my favorite is
smoked cheddar, mmm so good.
I got two types of probiotics,
which is very important for me.
I'm all about gut health

especially because I've
had issues over the years

with my gut, and probiotics
have done wonders for me.
So since becoming pregnant,

I've been taking 120 billion
plus 20 strain probiotic,
which is really intense high probiotic,
but typically I take the a 100 billion.

This one, the 100
billion's from Renew Life,

and then the other one 120
billion is by New Roots.
And over here we have some nut cheese.
These are cashew cheese.

We got Smokey Artichoke and
Herb and Chipotle Cheddar.

These are Nuts for
Cheese, that's the brand.
They're so good!
Oh my god!
I've tried so many different nut cheeses,
these ones are my favorite.
Little on the pricier side,
but it's so good.
It's like the best treat ever.
And down here we have some coconut milk.
I actually prefer to make my own milk,
but sometimes I just don't have the time
and we go through milk a lot

because we have smoothies,
and coffee, and cereal,
and we just use milk all day long.
But we don't use cow milk,

we always use coconut milk,
or almond milk, cashew milk.

Over here I've got a
massive bag of hemp hearts.

This is something that I
always have in the fridge.

It's actually good to
have it in the fridge
once you've opened it, to keep it fresh.

I put these in smoothies,
I put them on cereal,

I put them on salad, it's a
really good source of protein.
We'll start on the top shelf.

We have so many condiments,
for a tiny fridge that is,
but we are obsessed with condiments.
We love dipping whatever we can in sauces,

and using sauces to marinate
vegetables and meats and tofu,
so we're a big fan of condiments.
Instead of using soy sauce,

we use coconut aminos, and
this brand I really like,

Naked Coconuts, and you
can use it in stir fry,
you could use it on salads.
It's delicious.
It tastes even better than soy sauce.
If you do not have this in your fridge,
go to the grocery store right now,

well not right now after
you watch this video,

and get some because it
is just so delicious.
Another item we always have in our fridge
is apple cider vinegar,

because we use it for so
many different things.
I put it on all my salads,

as a salad dressing usually
with some olive oil.

And I also use it to clean
vegetables, especially lettuce.
We use it to clean our place, it's great.
It's a great cleaning product.
We have a tamari, organic tamari
so it's again a soy sauce substitute.
It's gluten free.
We've got pumpkin seed oil.
We got sriracha, sra-ra-racha,

and this is the organic
red hot sauce sriracha
by Simply Natural,

which is better than the
other typical sriracha
you see in most grocery stores.
This one's from Whole Foods.
Cholula! Where are you?
Where's the Cholula?
We can not forget about Cholula.

She wasn't in the fridge
because we used her for dinner.
Hot sauce from Mexico, and it's so good.
And, like every pregnant woman
or the majority of pregnant women,

you need to have pickles in
your fridge when your pregnant,
and Bubbie's Pickles are the best.
We have some Naan bread that Siya eats.

I'm gluten-free so I
would not be eating that,

but I do have some gluten-free
Millet Chia loaf here,

for like a morning with
almond butter or lunch.

I put avocado usually on,
with some salt and pepper
on a slice of this bread.
Organic kefir,

this is another thing
that's always in our fridge.
It's super good for your gut.
It's gotta tons of probiotics in it
and this brand I absolutely love,

it's from Pinehedge Farms,
its an Ontario company.
We also have Atlas's food.
Siya made food for him from scratch.

There's some chicken and
broccoli and carrots in there
that have been put in the food processor
and blended all together.
He's a lucky pup.
He gets like top of the line food here.
This copper mug, copper, not a mug.
What should it be called?
Copper, what's it called Siya?
- [Siya] Jug?
- Jugs!
(laughing)
You would remember that one.
(laughing)
We always have water in it,

and it keeps it nice and cold,
great in the summer time.
And copper's really good for you.
This is our fruit and veggie shelf,

plus we have some veggie
burgers and some tofu.
For fruits, we've got strawberries,

we've got blueberries, we've
got blackberries, all organic.
We've got some organic cucumbers,
we've got a field cucumber,
and then I don't know what is this,
a english cucumber or something?
Yellow and red tomatoes.

We got golden berries,
which are delicious.

And on our last shelf
here we have chocolate.
(whispering) Lots of chocolate.

Necessary, another thing
that's always in our fridge.
Dark chocolate.
We've got 85 percent, 82 percent,
and this is 67 mint dark chocolate.

And they're all open because
I eat it all the time.
(laughing)

Next up we have some
greens to make some salad.
We've got Vita eggs, free run eggs.
Siya eats these, I do not.
My stomach doesn't like eggs.
And then we've got zucchinis.

I been obsessed with
making zucchini noodles
with avocado pesto sauce.
(whispering) It is so good.

We actually have a
recipe in another video,
I'll link it in the description box below.
But we have these green bags as well,

and we have white ones that
keep the vegetables fresher
when they're in the fridge.
It's better than using plastic.

And lastly I told you like
small fridge, but it fits a lot.
We have our drawer at the bottom.

We've got one of the white
bags I was mentioning
with some kale.
We got purple kale this time around.

We've some basil to
make the zucchini pasta.
We've got carrots, we've got celery,
again, everything's organic.
Organic pepper, it's a red pepper.
Garlic and broccoli.

We also have a fruit bowl,
my favorite kind of bowl,
and our citrus bowl.
We go through a lot of lemons and limes.

I like to have lemon water
first thing in the morning,

and we've been making
a lot of guac lately.
You can't have guac without lime.

We've got a lot of oranges
because oranges are amazing.
And this bowl, we've got a lot of goodies.

We've got avocados, we've got
nectarines, we've got mangoes.

These are probably the
best mangoes I've had
in the last year.
Bananas and green apples.

We are outside Luna right now
and we have an outdoor fridge.
We have the NewAir Beverage Cooler,

and we got it because
after a year living in Luna
and being different RV parks,

we've seen a lot of RVs
that have outdoor fridges,
and we thought that is such a good idea,
because it's been a really hot summer,

and it's nice to have
nice fresh cold beverages
at your fingertips,
when you're lounging at a picnic table
or swinging in a hammock.

You don't have to go inside to
get something cold to drink.
We have coconut water.
We have the Vita Coco right now.
We get different types of coconut water

depending on which grocery
store we're at, what's on sale.

These ones are pretty good,
but they're not my favorite.
They're a little on the sweeter side.

They don't taste as natural as
other brands that I've tried.

We've got some bottled
water in the back here.
We have some meat, some really good meats
from one of the markets down the street.
We've got some chicken kabob here
that we can grill up on the barbecue.
We've got empanadas, (whispers) empanadas,
and we've got a Tuscany sausage.

In the middle shelving
area we have these ...
Pop Shoppe Black Cherry,

and I guess there's some
other flavors as well.
I have never actually had one of these.
I'm not really into soda,
but when we have guests they love them.
There's also a couple beers.
I would kill to have a beer right now,
but I will wait until the delivery room.

Push that baby out, and
then I'm having a Guinness.
Bottom shelf we've got some orange juice,

some organic orange
juice from Grown Right,
and we also have some Tzatziki.
So that's what's in our fridge right now,
outside fridge I should say.

So this little fridge can
actually hold 84 cans,

but as you can see we have
other things inside of it.

You don't have to just put
cans inside the fridge.
You can put whatever you want.
And it's been great for us

because we have such a tiny
fridge inside the Airstream,

which does hold a lot, but
especially during the summer
when you want cold drinks all the time,
this has been such a life saver.
I'm so glad we got it recently.

I'm gonna put links to this
fridge and the company,
they sell other things as well,
in the description box below
if you want to go and check that out.

I hope you enjoyed what's in
my fridge, Airstream edition,

and you were surprised at how
much we could actually fit
in our tiny fridge, a lot right?

And if you like this
video give it a thumbs up.

Subscribe to our channel if
you're not subscribed already.

Click that notification
bell so you get notified
when we release a video, because YouTube,
you gotta click arrows.
You just don't get notified.
Thanks so much for watching.

Be sure to check out our
other Airstream videos

if you're interested
in this type of living,
which I assume you are.
Go check those out, we've got lots of them
and so many more coming your way.

I am pregnant, I am not
smuggling a watermelon.
(laughs)
There's a baby brewing.
